venue.name: Charles River Museum of Industry and Innovation

item.description:
Steampunk has been a strand in science fiction since the 1980s. Steampunk in the recent Hugo nominations includes Boneshaker and "The Women of Nell Gwynne's". Other steampunk stories I have read recently are "Sandra Plays for the Cast Iron Man" and "A Serpent in the Gears". I'm sure you can think of more.

Today I would call steampunk an aesthestic that looks back to Victorian times and reimagines how technology could be used. Tomorrow I might have a different definition. Let's take a look at "Steampunk: Form and Design." Charles River Museum of Industry, and see what we think.

$5 adult admission.
I expect to meet near the front door. If you have trouble finding us, you can call my cell phone at 617-458-9790.

We could adjourn afterward to a nearby coffee shop, such as Cafe on the Common.

There is ample cheap parking on the Pine Street lot behind the Embassy Theater.
A short walk from the commuter rail station on the Porter Square/North Station line. Also accessible via buses from Watertown, Newton, Boston.

group.name: The Boston Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers Meetup Group

item.name: SteamPunk in SF Meetup
